children.name: obsession b2
children.definition: obsession an extreme unhealthy interest in something or worry about something, which stops you from thinking about anything else : nỗi ám ảnh
examples: gamblingbecame an obsession, and he eventually lost everything.
obsession with/for
picasso’s obsession with death and sickness greatly influenced his work.
i knew that if i wasn’t careful, my obsession for her could destroy me.
the current obsession with exam results is actually harming children’s education.
have an obsessionthe poet seems to have an obsession with death.
become//turn into an obsessionfor rosie, losing weight had become an obsession.
border on/upon obsession(= be almost as extreme as an obsession )sometimes his tidiness bordered on obsession.
a national obsession(= an obsession that the whole country has )in britain, the weather is a national obsession.
an unhealthy obsession(= an obsession that is not normal )our society seems to have an unhealthy obsession with staying young.
a dangerous obsessionmark had a dangerous obsession with fast cars.
a sexual obsessionsexual obsessions can take many forms.
the modern obsession with sththe modern obsession with celebrities' lives
be sth of an obsession(= be almost as strong as an obsession )the case became something of an obsession with him.
to the point of obsession(= used to say that something has stopped being a normal interest and become an extreme one )she was protective of her children, to the point of obsession.
be in the grip of an obsession(= have extreme feelings of interest in something or someone )at 15 i met heather and instantly fell into the grip of an obsession.

children.name: mania x
children.definition: mania a very strong desire for sth or interest in sth, especially one that affects a lot of people at the same time:tính nghiện, chứng điên cuồng, tính ham mê
examples: mania for
the victorian mania for butterfly collecting
a mania for a game called nibs ran through the school.
i had a mania for cleanliness, and once made him stay in all day while i washed all his clothes.
religious/football/disco etc mania
keep-fit mania has hit some of the girls in the office.
aunt edna was scathing about her cousin’s religious mania.

children.name: fixation x
children.definition: fixation an unnaturally strong interest in or love for sb/sth: “sự đóng chặt vào, cố định”
examples: fixation on/with/about
carlo has an absolute fixation with the royal family.
our fixation with diet and fitness
a mother fixation
the killing was the result of dougherty’s four year fixation with a co-worker who would not date him.

children.name: fascination c1
children.definition: fascination a very strong and unusual interest in a particular person, subject, or type of thing: sự mê hoặc
examples: fascination for/with
police knew of his fascination with guns.
what’s your sudden fascination with my boyfriend?
mark has a fascination for all things electrical.
in fascination
the children watched in fascination.

children.name: fetish x
children.definition: fetish an extremely strong and unreasonable interest in sth: cuồng, “mê tín, sùng bái”
examples: fetish for/about
suehasa realfetishabout keeping everything tidy.
americans seem to have a fetish for watering their golf courses.
a foot/hair/animal etc fetish
she told stories about the band’s alcoholic binges, their arrests on drug charges, and even about one member’s foot fetish.

children.name: preoccupation x
children.definition: preoccupation a strong interest in one thing, usually because you are worried about it, which means that you cannot pay attention to other things:mối bận tâm, mối lo lắng, mối ưu tư
examples: preoccupation with
georgina’s preoccupation with her appearance takes up most of her time.
writing a will is not evidence of a morbid preoccupation with death.

children.name: have an obsession with b2
children.definition: have an obsession with/forcó một nỗi ám ảnh với / cho
examples: my father always said i had an unhealthy obsession for spotty pop bands.
our french teacher had a neurotic obsession with correct punctuation.

children.name: obsessed b2
children.definition: obsessed sb who isobsessed, has an obsession about sb/sth. – used to show disapproval : ám ảnh
examples: madonna was being stalked by an obsessed fan.
obsessed by/with/about
she was obsessed by giles
he became obsessed in his old age with what to do with his immense wealth.
people are generally less obsessed about getting a tan than they used to be.

children.name: obsessive c2
children.definition: obsessive thinking or worrying about something all the time, so that you do not think about other things enough – used to show disapproval :ám ảnh
examples: she’s got this obsessive fear of losing control, so she never shows her emotions.
deep anxiety can cause obsessive behaviour.
an obsessive concern with cleanliness and order
obsessive about (doing) something
i try to stay fit, but i’m not obsessive about it.
i try to look after my body as best i can, but i’m not obsessive about it.
he's obsessiveaboutpunctuality.

children.name: can’t get sth out of your mind x
children.definition: can’t get sb/sth out of your mind to be unable to stop thinking about sb/sth, even when you do not want to think about them:
examples: since the divorce, he hadn’t been able to get bonniet out of his mind.
she knew the story wasn’t true, but she couldn’t get it out of her mind.

children.name: have a thing about x
children.definition: have a thing about informal to have an unreasonably strong interest in, liking for, or fear of sth :
examples: joanne’s got a thing about her hair. she’s always changing the style.
the captain had a thing about neat handwriting; in fact he couldn’t bear to look at anything that wasn’t beautifully written.

children.name: obsess x
children.definition: obsess if sb/sth obsesses you, you think or worry about them all the time and you cannot think about anything else – used to show disapproval : ám ảnh
examples: the idea that she was being punished began to obsess her.
the whole relationship obsessed me for years.
obsess about
some women obsess about their thighs and stomachs.
she used to obsessabouther weight.

children.name: have a one-track mind x
children.definition: have a one-track mind to be continuously thinking about one subject so that you often talk about it when there is no reason to:
examples: boys of that age have a one track mind. all they think about is sex.

children.name: have an unhealthy interest in u
children.definition: have an unhealthy interest in to have a strong and unnatural interest in sth, so that you think about it a lot:có một quan tâm đến không lành mạnh
examples: as a child, quinlan had an unhealthy interest in death.

children.name: absorb b2
children.definition: absorbverbinterest very much
examples: miệt mài, mê mải, chăm chú; lôi cuốn, thu hút sự chú ý
if someone's work, or a book, film, etc. absorbs them, or they are absorbed in it, their attention is given completely to it
_simon was so absorbedinhis book, he didn't even notice me come in.

children.name: preoccupied x
children.definition: preoccupied/priːˈɒkjɑpaɪdǁ-ˈɑːk-/  someone who is preoccupied isworriedorthinkingabout other things, and tends to forget about someone or something else:
examples: bận tâm
▪ parents are often too busy, tired, or preoccupied to give their children the time and attention they need.
phụ huynh thường quá bận rộn , mệt mỏi và bận tâm đến nỗi không cho trẻ nhỏ đủ thời gian và sự quan tâm chúng cần
preoccupied with : bận tâm với
▪ most russians are preoccupied with matters close to home, their economic conditions in particular.
hầu hết người nghe đang bận tâm về một vấn đề có ảnh hưởng sâu sắc đến họ, điều kiện nền kinh tế nói chung
preoccupiedadjective bận tâm, lo lắng, không thảnh thơi, không rảnh rang; lơ đảng
thinking or worrying about something too much
_she's been very preoccupied recently because her mother has been very ill.
_why is the media so preoccupiedwiththe love lives of politicians?

children.name: dwell on sth c1
children.definition: dwell onsthphrasal verb dừng lại ở; chăm chú vào; nhấn lâu vào; nhắc đi nhắc lại
examples: to keep thinking or talking about something, especially something bad or unpleasant
_in his speech, he dwelt on the plight of the sick and the hungry.

children.name: to think about sth a lot
dwell on c1
children.definition: dwell on to spend too much time thinking about sth sad or unpleasant - use this especially when telling someone not to do this:chăm chú vào
examples: ▪ brian’s still dwelling too much on the past, in my opinion.
▪ there’s no use in dwelling on problems that we can’t do anything about.

children.name: give sth a lot of thought b1
children.definition: give sth a lot of thought
examples: ▪ i’ve given this a lot of thought, because we all know that health care issues are very important today.
give a lot of thought to sth
▪ tony has given a lot of thought to what made his father a legendary coach.
▪ many of the new west-coast designers have obviously given a lot of thought to their furniture designs.

children.name: brood x
children.definition: brood  to keep thinking for a long time about sth that worries you or that makes you angry or upset:nhiền ngẫm, suy nghĩ ủ ê
examples: ▪ austin sat in the corner brooding and looking sorry for himself.
brood on/over/about
▪ you can’t spend all your time at home brooding about the way he treated you.
▪ the poetry spends a lot of time brooding over death.

children.name: have sth on your mind c2
children.definition: have something on your mind/hæv (something) ɒn jɔːʳ ˈmaɪnd/  to be thinking about something all the time, especially because you are worried about it:
examples: có cái gì trong tâm trí
▪ she has something on her mind, but she won’t tell us what it is.
cô ấy có một điều gì đó trong tâm trí cô, nhưng cô ấy sẽ không cho chúng tôi biết đó là gì.
▪ ‘should we tell dad?’ ‘no, he’s got a lot on his mind right now.’
'chúng ta có nên nói với bố mình không?' 'không, anh ấy có rất nhiều suy nghĩ của mình ngay bây giờ.'
be on somebody’s mind
trong tâm trí của ai đó
▪ come on, tell me what’s on your mind.
thôi nào, cho tôi biết ý nghĩ của bạn là gì.
▪ i’m not looking forward to the interview. it’s been on my mind all week.
tôi không mong đợi buổi phỏng vấn. nó đã được trong tâm trí của tôi cả tuần.

children.name: be wrapped up in x
children.definition: be wrapped up in to spend all your time thinking about something that concerns you, for example your work, so that you have no time to think about other things or other people: bị cuốn vào
examples: ▪ these days she’s so wrapped up in her children she never sees anybody.
▪ sometimes the professors are so wrapped up in their graduate students, they ignore the undergraduates.

children.name: can’t stop thinking about u
children.definition: can’t stop thinking about sb/sthalsocan’t get somebody/something out of my mind informal to be unable to stop thinking about sb/sth, even when you do not want to think about them:
examples: ▪ after the first three months of the pregnancy were over, i just couldn’t stop thinking about food.
▪ i just can’t get that poor family out of my mind.

children.name: be preoccupied
children.definition: /biː prɪˈɒkjɑpaɪdǁ-ˈɑːk-/  to be thinking all the time about something that is worrying you or that is important to you, so that it is difficult to think about anything else: bận tâm
examples: ▪ what is being done to end the crisis which has preoccupied the country’s political leadership?
be preoccupied with
▪ my mother was preoccupied with my brother and his illness, so i was allowed to do what i wanted.

children.name: turn sth over in your mind x
children.definition: turn something over in your mind/ˌtɜːʳn something əʊvər ɪn jɔːʳ ˈmaɪnd/  to think about something carefully and repeatedly, especially something you do not fully understand or that you have not made a final decision about:
examples: nghiền ngẫm
▪ when dan left, mae stayed there, turning his invitation over in her mind.
khi dan ra đi, mae ở lại đó, nghiền ngẫm mời của anh ấy trong tâm trí cô.
▪ as he studied the picture of the little boy, he began to turn an idea over in his mind.
khi nghiên cứu hình ảnh cậu bé, cậu bắt đầu đưa ra một ý tưởng nghiền ngẫm trong tâm trí cậu.

children.name: have sth on the brain x
children.definition: have sth on the brain spoken to be always thinking about a particular thing - use this when you want to say that sb thinks about something far too much:bị ám ảnh
examples: ▪ it’s unbelievable - you have sex on the brain 24 hours a day!
